title: Who controls the machines that control Artificial Intelligence?
description: The capability to shape AI's trajectory is concentrated amongst the few owners of compute farms who can afford to power and cool massive machines.
content: Picture a data center on the edge of a desert plateau. Inside, row after row of servers glow and buzz, moving air through vast cooling towers, consuming more electricity than the surrounding towns combined. This is not science fiction. It is the real... [7217 chars]

title: Nearly a third of Americans have had a ‘romantic relationship’ with an AI bot, new survey says
description: More than half of those surveyed (54 percent) said that they had some sort of relationship with an artificial intelligence platform
content:
Almost one third of Americans say that they have had an “intimate or romantic relationship” with an AI chatbot, a new study has found.

title: AI causes slight labor market effects so far, but tech disruptions can take time: study
description: Although a chorus of concerns has arisen about the potential of artificial intelligence to displace U.S. workers, a study by the Budget Lab at Yale demonstrates minimal impact thus far on the job market.
content:
AI causes slight labor market effects so far, but tech disruptions can take time: study

title: Artificial Intelligence and the Erosion of Trust
description: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing nearly every sector of modern life— however, it can be used for great good or great harm.
content: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing nearly every sector of modern life—from medicine and education to software and communication. Like any tool, however, it can be used for great good or great harm. Sadly, AI is now being used by foreign crimi... [3963 chars]

title: From job ads to press releases: AI-written content rises sharply across multiple sectors
description: Since 2022, American companies, consumers, and even the United Nations have used large language models—artificial intelligence (AI) systems such as ChatGPT that are trained to create text that reads like human-generated writing. In a study published in the journal Patterns, researchers reveal that AI is used in an average of 17% of analyzed corporate and governmental written content, from job posts to press releases, and this rate will likely continue to increase.

title: OpenAI Is World's Top Startup With $500B Valuation After Employee Share Sale
description: OpenAI has reportedly finalized a secondary share sale that values the artificial intelligence company at $500 billion, making the ChatGPT owner the world's most valuable startup.
content:
OpenAI has reportedly finalized a secondary share sale that values the artificial intelligence company at $500 billion, making the ChatGPT owner the world's most valuable startup ever.

title: How Credit Card Companies Are Using
description: Artificial intelligence has been a crucial part of the industry for decades, and more uses of the technology are coming — including, maybe, AI agents that make purchasing decisions for you.
content:

title: US Stocks Rally to Records on OpenAI Optimism: Markets Wrap
description: (Bloomberg) -- Technology stocks drove US equities to fresh highs after an OpenAI share sale catapulted the firm to the world’s most valuable startup, bolstering optimism for artificial intelligence.
content:

title: Samsung, SK Hynix To Supply Chips To OpenAI
description: South Koreas top two semiconductor manufacturers Samsung Electronics Co. and SK hynix Inc. will supply OpenAI Inc., the worlds largest artificial intelligence (AI) company, with up to 900,000 wafers of DRAM per month by 2029, according to a report.
content: Seoul: South Korea's top two semiconductor manufacturers Samsung Electronics Co. and SK hynix Inc. will supply OpenAI Inc., the world's largest artificial intelligence (AI) company, with up to 900,000 wafers of DRAM per month by 2029, according to a ... [2397 chars]

title: U.S. stock futures rise as AI optimism lifts S&P 500 and Nasdaq - Dow lags amid government shutdown pressure
description: US stock futures climbed today as optimism around artificial intelligence boosted the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. Investors showed confidence despite the ongoing government shutdown, which kept the Dow mostly flat. Tech and AI stocks led gains, pushing markets higher on hopes for future growth and potential interest rate cuts.
